meanings.definition: To act on an impulse or sudden desire.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't resist impulsing and bought the colorful dress.
meanings.sent2: He impulsed to jump into the pool on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The cat impulsed to chase after the moving laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: Her heart impulsed her to confess her feelings to him.
meanings.sent5: The child impulsing to grab the cookie jar from the shelf.

meanings.definition: The act of applying an impulse or sudden force.
meanings.sent1: The impulsing of the hammer on the nail was loud.
meanings.sent2: He felt the impulsing of the wind against his face.
meanings.sent3: The impulsing of the door made it difficult to open.
meanings.sent4: The impulsing of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The sudden impulsing of the car brakes startled the passengers.

meanings.definition: The process of sending out electrical impulses.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the impulsing of signals in the brain.
meanings.sent2: The machine's impulsing of electricity was crucial for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The impulsing of the wires caused a spark.
meanings.sent4: The impulsing of the neurons is essential for brain function.
meanings.sent5: The impulsing of the circuit completed the connection.
